intro: Barkhausia leucorhodia, commonly known as the white-haired beard veldt, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid conditions, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Barkhausia leucorhodia is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
